Package OOADHW3.Q3

Class DFTMatrixMutexSync

java.lang.Object
OOADHW3.Q3.DFTMatrixMutexSync
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class DFTMatrixMutexSync extends Object implements Runnable
This class is used for DFT calculation of a 2-dimensional complex number array using threads. It uses Mutex structures for synchronization.

The following sites were used for the algorithm. https://github.com/TTrojanovich/2D_Discrete_Fourier https://www.nayuki.io/page/how-to-implement-the-discrete-fourier-transform

  • Constructor Details

    • DFTMatrixMutexSync

      public DFTMatrixMutexSync(Complex[][] mat1, Complex[][] mat2, int x0, int y0, int x1, int y1, int N, Semaphore sync, int threadSize)
      Constructor Method
      Parameters:
      mat1 - matrix 1
      mat2 - matrix 2
      x0 - row starting point
      y0 - col starting point
      x1 - row ending point
      y1 - col ending point
      N - number of elements of the array
      sync - object to be used for synchronization
      threadSize - thread size

    • run

      public void run()
      When an object implementing interface Runnable is used to create a thread, starting the thread causes the object's run method to be called in that separately executing thread.

      The general contract of the method run is that it may take any action whatsoever.

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      See Also:
      • Thread.run()
